tool_input.content:
--- theme: ../ layout: default clicks: 4 ---

Example: Front-End Debug Skill

The Problem

The manual debugging loop:
  1. Add console.log statements
  2. Reload the page
  3. Screenshot the UI state
  4. Copy console output
  5. Paste into AI chat
  6. Discuss, repeat...
"I'm a decent front-end dev, but React state management is a beast"
What if the agent could:
  • Add debug logs itself
  • Refresh the page for you
  • Pull console logs directly
  • Screenshot the state automatically
  • Clean up when done completely

The Skill

# .claude/skills/browser-mcp/SKILL.md
---
name: browser-mcp
description: Browser automation via MCP
for debugging and design critique.
---
# Key Tools
browser_screenshot, browser_get_console_logs
browser_navigate, browser_snapshot
# Debug Log Convention
console.log('[DEBUG-AGENT]',
'[Component.fn]', { data });
// Cleanup: grep [DEBUG-AGENT] → remove
Browser MCP:
  • Real browser access
  • No separate instance
  • Auth already handled
  • See what user sees
Log convention:
  • Grep-able marker
  • Easy cleanup
  • No leftover slop

The Workflow

SETUP
Confirm page
→
OBSERVE
Screenshot + logs
→
INSTRUMENT
Add debug logs
→
REFRESH
Reload page
→
ITERATE
Loop until found
Once root cause found:
FIX
Propose & implement solution
CLEANUP
Remove all [DEBUG-AGENT] logs
Key principle:
Agent handles mechanical tedium
User confirms judgment calls
"Is this the right page?" "Should I apply this fix?"

In Action

User
"The dashboard data isn't loading after login"
Agent
"I see you're on /dashboard. Let me observe..."
> browser_screenshot // Capture visual state
> browser_get_console_logs // Pull errors
> Adding instrumentation to useAuth hook...
> console.log('[DEBUG-AGENT]', '[useAuth.effect]', { token })
> browser_navigate // Refresh page
> browser_get_console_logs // Check new output
> Found it: token undefined on first render
No copy-paste. No manual screenshots. Clean codebase when done.

The Skill

# SKILL.md
---
name: browser-mcp
description: Browser automation
---
# Tools
browser_screenshot, browser_navigate
browser_get_console_logs, ...
# Debug Log Convention
console.log('[DEBUG-AGENT]',
'[Context]', { data });
# Cookbook
- IF: Debugging front-end
THEN: workflows/debug.md
# workflows/debug.md
<workflow id="frontend-debugging">
<phase name="Setup">
Confirm page with user...
<phase name="Observe">
Screenshot + console logs...
<phase name="Instrument">
Add [DEBUG-AGENT] logs...
<phase name="Refresh">
Reload, re-observe...
<phase name="Fix_and_Cleanup">
Apply fix, remove markers...
</workflow>
